Mode of trial and maximum penalty for certain animal welfare offences
	Section 32 of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 (post-conviction powers:imprisonment or fine) is amended as follows.
	In subsection (1) (penalty for offence under any of sections 4, 5, 6(1) and(2), 7 and 8 of the Animal Welfare Act 2006), for the words from “on summaryconviction” to the end substitute “—
		on summary conviction, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months,or to a fine, or to both;
		on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 5years, or to a fine, or to both.”
	After subsection (4) insert—
		“(4A)In relation to an offence committed before the commencement of paragraph24(2) of Schedule 22 to the Sentencing Act 2020, the reference in subsection(1)(a) to 12 months is to be read as a reference to 6 months.”
	In subsection (5), omit “(1)(a),”.
Extent, commencement and short title
	This Act extends to England and Wales only.
	This Act comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginningwith the day on which it is passed.
	The amendments made by this Act do not apply to offences committed beforethis Act comes into force.
	This Act may be cited as the Animal Welfare (Sentencing) Act 2021.
